abstract.value: <emph render='italic'>Labor History</emph> is an academic journal publishing articles on the history of the labor movement in the United States and other countries.  Between 1960 and 2003 the journal was published by the Tamiment Institute, later the Tamiment Library at New York University.  The <emph render='italic'>Labor History</emph> Records document the publication of the journal between 1960 and 2010 and consist of correspondence between editors and authors, and minutes of board meetings.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Labor History Records; TAM 257; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.281.

<emph render='italic'>Labor History</emph> is an academic journal publishing articles on the history of the labor movement in the United States and other countries.  Between 1960 and 2003 the journal was published by the Tamiment Institute, later the Tamiment Library at New York University.  Daniel J. Leab was editor from 1974 into the late 1990s.

The <emph render='italic'>Labor History</emph> Records document the publication of the journal between 1960 and 2010 and consist of correspondence between editors and authors, and minutes of board meetings.  The bulk of the correspondence is that of Daniel J. Leab as editor and includes correspondence with authors and other members of the editorial board.  Also included is the correspondence of Sidney Fine who served as a member of the editorial board in the 1980s.
